content: Do a straddle stretch. Sit on your bottom on the ground. Stretch your legs long and open them up as wide as they will go. Point your feet and place your hands on the ground in front of you to balance yourself. You should feel this stretch in your hips and your inner thighs. [1] Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds. Try to open your legs wider each time you do this stretch. The goal is to eventually be able to do a split. Practice a pike stretch. Sit on your bottom with your legs extended in front of you and your arms lifted straight overhead. Fold at your waist and reach your arms towards your toes. [2] Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds. You may not be able to reach your toes right away. Keep trying and as you get more flexible, you’ll get closer and closer to touching them. Try a lunge stretch. Stand with your left leg in front of you and your right leg behind you. Bend your left leg at a 90 degree angle, and rest your right leg on the ground to support yourself. Rest your hands on your left leg and use them to push your left leg even deeper into the stretch. [3] Stay in your left lunge for 15 seconds. After 15 seconds, switch and do the same thing on your right side. Do cross body arm stretches. Stand with your feet apart (they should be slightly wider than your shoulders). Reach your right arm across your body, and use your left arm to support it and lock it into place. [4] Pull your arm tight until you feel a stretch in your shoulder. Hold your arm stretch for ten seconds, before alternating and doing the same stretch on the left side. Stretch your arms behind your back. Standing straight, cross your right arm behind your back. Reach back with your left hand and grab your right hand. Use the left hand to stretch the right arm. Hold the stretch for about 15 seconds. Repeat. This time, use your right hand to grab and pull your left hand. As you do this, try stretching your neck. Bend your head towards the same side as the arm that is grabbing and pulling. If you are grabbing with your left hand, tip your head to the left side. Do side bends. Stand with your feet apart (they should be slightly wider than your hips) and your arms outstretched. Lean over to your right side until your right arm hangs down towards the ground and your left arm reaches straight up over your head. [5] Pull your left arm taut until you feel a stretch in your left shoulder and the left side of your body. Hold this stretch for ten seconds on the right side, before switching sides and reaching with your right hand. As you bend to the side, dangle your left arm towards the ground and stretch the right arm straight up. Try the Superman. Lie on the ground on your stomach with your arms stretched out in front of you (your body should be in one straight line). Lift your arms and feet off the ground; your arms should be in line with your ears and your feet should be lifted a little higher than your hips. [6] Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds. As you get more flexible, try to lift your feet a little higher. Start with jumping jacks. Stand straight up with your feet together and your arms by your sides. Jump to separate your feet, while simultaneously lifting your arms overhead. Then jump your feet back together, while simultaneously returning your arms to your sides. [7] Do fifteen jumping jacks in a row to get your blood pumping. As you get older and stronger, you may want to increase the number of jumping jacks you do. Do arm circles. Stand with your legs slightly wider than your hips. Lift your arms overhead, then make a circle with your arms going towards your hips, then up over your head. [8] Keep your arms straight at all times. Do ten arm circles going forward, then reverse and do ten backwards arm circles. Try skipping. Stand on your right foot, with your left foot in the air. Hop on the right foot, then step down on your left foot. Speed this motion up until you are able to skip. Once you are confident skipping, skip back and forth for a minute at a time. As you get stronger and more flexible, increase the length of time that you spend skipping each day. Practice squats. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing forward. Keeping the weight in your heels, slowly bend your knees and lower your body towards the ground as though you were about sit down in a chair. [9] Pause at the ground, then slowly rise back up to your previous position and do the motion again. Hold your arms out in front of you for balance. Make sure that your knees do not go over your toes. If you can see the top of your shoes, you're doing this move right. If not, your knees are too far forward. Try quad pulls. Bend your left knee and pull your left leg behind your body, using your left hand to support it. Reach your right arm toward the ceiling, as far as it will go. After your arm is lifted, raise up onto your right toes and balance there. [10] When you’ve got a good stretch on your left side, switch and do the same thing on your right side. Alternate back and forth. Do ten rounds on each side. Try downward facing dog. From a standing position, fold your body over at the waist and allow your hands to touch the floor. Walk your hands forward until your body resembles that of an upside down letter V. [11] Your hands should be shoulder-width apart. Your fingers should be spread wide. Keep your feet hips-width distance apart. Try to touch your heels to the floor. Stand in tree pose. Stand straight up with your feet together. Lift your right foot and tuck it into the space right above your left knee, with your right knee facing out. Put your palms together in front of your heart. [12] Stand in this position for ten seconds, then switch sides. When your feet are together, your big toes should be touching, and your heels should be slightly apart. Make sure your weight is evenly balanced. Experiment with bow pose. Lie on your stomach with your arms running beside your body – make sure to keep your palms face up. Bend your knees and grab your ankles with your hands. [13] When you breathe in, try to lift your knees and thighs even further away from the floor. Stay here for five seconds. Take a break, then try this pose two more times.

<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Flexible-(for-Children)">How to Be Flexible (for Children)</a></h1>
<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">
	
	Co-authored by <a class="expert_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		Michele Dolan</a>
</div>
<p class="vertical_toc" id="method_toc">
<span class="header_toc">Explore this Article</span>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Increasing_Flexibility_Through_Static_Stretching_sub" id="">Increasing Flexibility Through Static Stretching</a>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Using_Dynamic_Stretching_to_Strengthen_Flexibility_sub" id="">Using Dynamic Stretching to Strengthen Flexibility</a>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Becoming_More_Flexible_Through_Active_Stretching_sub" id="">Becoming More Flexible Through Active Stretching</a>

<div id="sp_icon_body">
		This article was co-authored by <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan">Michele Dolan</a>. Michele Dolan is a BCRPA certified Personal Trainer in British Columbia. She has been a personal trainer and fitness instructor since 2002.<br/><br/>There are <a href="#references">13 references</a> cited in this article, which can be found at the bottom of the page.
		
	</div>
</div>
<p>If you have dreams of becoming a successful gymnast, dancer or athlete, you will need to be as strong and as flexible as possible. Before you start stretching, there are a few terms you need to know. Static stretching is when you hold a stretch in a challenging, but still comfortable position. Dynamic stretching involves repeatedly moving through the same range of motion and active stretching is when you contract a muscle in opposition to the muscle you’re currently stretching. Now that you know the terms, it’s time to warm up.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Increasing_Flexibility_Through_Static_Stretching_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Increasing_Flexibility_Through_Static_Stretching">Increasing Flexibility Through Static Stretching</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-1-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-1-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_a60ef22bb9" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a60ef22bb9')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do a straddle stretch.</b> Sit on your bottom on the ground. Stretch your legs long and open them up as wide as they will go. Point your feet and place your hands on the ground in front of you to balance yourself. You should feel this stretch in your hips and your inner thighs.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds.</li>
<li>Try to open your legs wider each time you do this stretch. The goal is to eventually be able to do a split.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-2-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-2-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6b/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_056056c586" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_056056c586')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6b/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Practice a pike stretch.</b> Sit on your bottom with your legs extended in front of you and your arms lifted straight overhead. Fold at your waist and reach your arms towards your toes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds.</li>
<li>You may not be able to reach your toes right away. Keep trying and as you get more flexible, you’ll get closer and closer to touching them.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-3-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-3-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_3e913062c1" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3e913062c1')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try a lunge stretch.</b> Stand with your left leg in front of you and your right leg behind you. Bend your left leg at a 90 degree angle, and rest your right leg on the ground to support yourself. Rest your hands on your left leg and use them to push your left leg even deeper into the stretch.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Stay in your left lunge for 15 seconds.</li>
<li>After 15 seconds, switch and do the same thing on your right side.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-4-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-4-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_d39e58f091" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d39e58f091')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do cross body arm stretches.</b> Stand with your feet apart (they should be slightly wider than your shoulders). Reach your right arm across your body, and use your left arm to support it and lock it into place.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Pull your arm tight until you feel a stretch in your shoulder.</li>
<li>Hold your arm stretch for ten seconds, before alternating and doing the same stretch on the left side.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your arms behind your back.</b> Standing straight, cross your right arm behind your back. Reach back with your left hand and grab your right hand. Use the left hand to stretch the right arm. Hold the stretch for about 15 seconds. Repeat. This time, use your right hand to grab and pull your left hand.
<ul>
<li>As you do this, try stretching your neck. Bend your head towards the same side as the arm that is grabbing and pulling. If you are grabbing with your left hand, tip your head to the left side.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-5-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-5-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_bee7994011" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_bee7994011')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do side bends.</b> Stand with your feet apart (they should be slightly wider than your hips) and your arms outstretched. Lean over to your right side until your right arm hangs down towards the ground and your left arm reaches straight up over your head.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Pull your left arm taut until you feel a stretch in your left shoulder and the left side of your body.</li>
<li>Hold this stretch for ten seconds on the right side, before switching sides and reaching with your right hand. As you bend to the side, dangle your left arm towards the ground and stretch the right arm straight up.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-6-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-6-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_5fd84061d5" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5fd84061d5')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try the Superman.</b> Lie on the ground on your stomach with your arms stretched out in front of you (your body should be in one straight line). Lift your arms and feet off the ground; your arms should be in line with your ears and your feet should be lifted a little higher than your hips.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds.</li>
<li>As you get more flexible, try to lift your feet a little higher.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Using_Dynamic_Stretching_to_Strengthen_Flexibility_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Using_Dynamic_Stretching_to_Strengthen_Flexibility">Using Dynamic Stretching to Strengthen Flexibility</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-7-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-7-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_b6eedc29c6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b6eedc29c6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Start with jumping jacks.</b> Stand straight up with your feet together and your arms by your sides. Jump to separate your feet, while simultaneously lifting your arms overhead. Then jump your feet back together, while simultaneously returning your arms to your sides.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Do fifteen jumping jacks in a row to get your blood pumping.</li>
<li>As you get older and stronger, you may want to increase the number of jumping jacks you do.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-8-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-8-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_fd303441cf" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fd303441cf')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do arm circles.</b> Stand with your legs slightly wider than your hips. Lift your arms overhead, then make a circle with your arms going towards your hips, then up over your head.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Keep your arms straight at all times.</li>
<li>Do ten arm circles going forward, then reverse and do ten backwards arm circles.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-9-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-9-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_4bd0314a38" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4bd0314a38')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try skipping.</b> Stand on your right foot, with your left foot in the air. Hop on the right foot, then step down on your left foot. Speed this motion up until you are able to skip.

<ul>
<li>Once you are confident skipping, skip back and forth for a minute at a time.</li>
<li>As you get stronger and more flexible, increase the length of time that you spend skipping each day.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-10-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-10-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_581ca400aa" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_581ca400aa')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Practice squats.</b> Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing forward. Keeping the weight in your heels, slowly bend your knees and lower your body towards the ground as though you were about sit down in a chair.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Pause at the ground, then slowly rise back up to your previous position and do the motion again.</li>
<li>Hold your arms out in front of you for balance.</li>
<li>Make sure that your knees do not go over your toes. If you can see the top of your shoes, you're doing this move right. If not, your knees are too far forward.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Becoming_More_Flexible_Through_Active_Stretching_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Becoming_More_Flexible_Through_Active_Stretching">Becoming More Flexible Through Active Stretching</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-11-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-11-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_a41cafe8a7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a41cafe8a7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try quad pulls.</b> Bend your left knee and pull your left leg behind your body, using your left hand to support it. Reach your right arm toward the ceiling, as far as it will go. After your arm is lifted, raise up onto your right toes and balance there.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>When you’ve got a good stretch on your left side, switch and do the same thing on your right side.</li>
<li>Alternate back and forth. Do ten rounds on each side.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-12-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-12-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-12-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_73dc70b77e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_73dc70b77e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-12-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try downward facing dog.</b> From a standing position, fold your body over at the waist and allow your hands to touch the floor. Walk your hands forward until your body resembles that of an upside down letter V.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Your hands should be shoulder-width apart.</li>
<li>Your fingers should be spread wide.</li>
<li>Keep your feet hips-width distance apart.</li>
<li>Try to touch your heels to the floor.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-13-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-13-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_4e6c2454c8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4e6c2454c8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stand in tree pose.</b> Stand straight up with your feet together. Lift your right foot and tuck it into the space right above your left knee, with your right knee facing out. Put your palms together in front of your heart.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Stand in this position for ten seconds, then switch sides.</li>
<li>When your feet are together, your big toes should be touching, and your heels should be slightly apart.</li>
<li>Make sure your weight is evenly balanced.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-14-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1433942" href="#/Image:Be-Flexible-(for-Children)-Step-14-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_5f83057195" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5f83057195')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Be Flexible (for Children) Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid1433942-v4-728px-Be-Flexible-%28for-Children%29-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Experiment with bow pose.</b> Lie on your stomach with your arms running beside your body – make sure to keep your palms face up. Bend your knees and grab your ankles with your hands.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>When you breathe in, try to lift your knees and thighs even further away from the floor.</li>
<li>Stay here for five seconds. Take a break, then try this pose two more times.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>Do not hold a stretch for longer than 30 seconds.</li>
<li>If you are doing stretching for martial arts or karate then you might need to do more intense exercises. Remember that these exercises are just warm up, so ignore those who say you have to undergo pain while stretching. Pay attention to your body and what it is saying to you. When you feel pain while stretching, your body is saying to stop or at least be less vigorous, so do so.</li>
<li>If you are preparing for a major competition then don't over stretch, it will hurt and make you perform badly.</li>
<li>Remember, this will take time so be patient.</li>
<li>When stretching, try listening to your favorite songs.</li>
<li>When you are performing a stretch such as a pike sit, try putting some sort of interesting book or video game in front of you so that you have to stretch to reach the item. Just make sure you don't over-stretch.</li>
<li>Keep on trying--you'll get there some day.</li>
<li>If you are stretching for dance, try not to over-do it. Your muscles might get cramped, and you won't have enough power in your legs.</li>
<li>Never be in a rush to accomplish a stretch.</li>
<li>Some stretches may be more difficult than others. Be patient and slowly work your way up to becoming more flexible.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section warnings sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Warnings">Warnings</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="warnings">
<ul>
<li>If you experience pain when stretching, stop stretching immediately.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

title: How to Be Flexible (for Children)
content_html:
Do a straddle stretch. Sit on your bottom on the ground. Stretch your legs long and open them up as wide as they will go. Point your feet and place your hands on the ground in front of you to balance yourself. You should feel this stretch in your hips and your inner thighs.[1]
  • Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds.
  • Try to open your legs wider each time you do this stretch. The goal is to eventually be able to do a split.
Practice a pike stretch. Sit on your bottom with your legs extended in front of you and your arms lifted straight overhead. Fold at your waist and reach your arms towards your toes.[2]
  • Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds.
  • You may not be able to reach your toes right away. Keep trying and as you get more flexible, you’ll get closer and closer to touching them.
Try a lunge stretch. Stand with your left leg in front of you and your right leg behind you. Bend your left leg at a 90 degree angle, and rest your right leg on the ground to support yourself. Rest your hands on your left leg and use them to push your left leg even deeper into the stretch.[3]
  • Stay in your left lunge for 15 seconds.
  • After 15 seconds, switch and do the same thing on your right side.
Do cross body arm stretches. Stand with your feet apart (they should be slightly wider than your shoulders). Reach your right arm across your body, and use your left arm to support it and lock it into place.[4]
  • Pull your arm tight until you feel a stretch in your shoulder.
  • Hold your arm stretch for ten seconds, before alternating and doing the same stretch on the left side.
Stretch your arms behind your back. Standing straight, cross your right arm behind your back. Reach back with your left hand and grab your right hand. Use the left hand to stretch the right arm. Hold the stretch for about 15 seconds. Repeat. This time, use your right hand to grab and pull your left hand.
  • As you do this, try stretching your neck. Bend your head towards the same side as the arm that is grabbing and pulling. If you are grabbing with your left hand, tip your head to the left side.
Do side bends. Stand with your feet apart (they should be slightly wider than your hips) and your arms outstretched. Lean over to your right side until your right arm hangs down towards the ground and your left arm reaches straight up over your head.[5]
  • Pull your left arm taut until you feel a stretch in your left shoulder and the left side of your body.
  • Hold this stretch for ten seconds on the right side, before switching sides and reaching with your right hand. As you bend to the side, dangle your left arm towards the ground and stretch the right arm straight up.
Try the Superman. Lie on the ground on your stomach with your arms stretched out in front of you (your body should be in one straight line). Lift your arms and feet off the ground; your arms should be in line with your ears and your feet should be lifted a little higher than your hips.[6]
  • Stay in this stretch for fifteen seconds.
  • As you get more flexible, try to lift your feet a little higher.
Start with jumping jacks. Stand straight up with your feet together and your arms by your sides. Jump to separate your feet, while simultaneously lifting your arms overhead. Then jump your feet back together, while simultaneously returning your arms to your sides.[7]
  • Do fifteen jumping jacks in a row to get your blood pumping.
  • As you get older and stronger, you may want to increase the number of jumping jacks you do.
Do arm circles. Stand with your legs slightly wider than your hips. Lift your arms overhead, then make a circle with your arms going towards your hips, then up over your head.[8]
  • Keep your arms straight at all times.
  • Do ten arm circles going forward, then reverse and do ten backwards arm circles.
Try skipping. Stand on your right foot, with your left foot in the air. Hop on the right foot, then step down on your left foot. Speed this motion up until you are able to skip.
  • Once you are confident skipping, skip back and forth for a minute at a time.
  • As you get stronger and more flexible, increase the length of time that you spend skipping each day.
Practice squats. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing forward. Keeping the weight in your heels, slowly bend your knees and lower your body towards the ground as though you were about sit down in a chair.[9]
  • Pause at the ground, then slowly rise back up to your previous position and do the motion again.
  • Hold your arms out in front of you for balance.
  • Make sure that your knees do not go over your toes. If you can see the top of your shoes, you're doing this move right. If not, your knees are too far forward.
Try quad pulls. Bend your left knee and pull your left leg behind your body, using your left hand to support it. Reach your right arm toward the ceiling, as far as it will go. After your arm is lifted, raise up onto your right toes and balance there.[10]
  • When you’ve got a good stretch on your left side, switch and do the same thing on your right side.
  • Alternate back and forth. Do ten rounds on each side.
Try downward facing dog. From a standing position, fold your body over at the waist and allow your hands to touch the floor. Walk your hands forward until your body resembles that of an upside down letter V.[11]
  • Your hands should be shoulder-width apart.
  • Your fingers should be spread wide.
  • Keep your feet hips-width distance apart.
  • Try to touch your heels to the floor.
Stand in tree pose. Stand straight up with your feet together. Lift your right foot and tuck it into the space right above your left knee, with your right knee facing out. Put your palms together in front of your heart.[12]
  • Stand in this position for ten seconds, then switch sides.
  • When your feet are together, your big toes should be touching, and your heels should be slightly apart.
  • Make sure your weight is evenly balanced.
Experiment with bow pose. Lie on your stomach with your arms running beside your body – make sure to keep your palms face up. Bend your knees and grab your ankles with your hands.[13]
  • When you breathe in, try to lift your knees and thighs even further away from the floor.
  • Stay here for five seconds. Take a break, then try this pose two more times.
